name: Monocurl Project
summary: Learn about .MCF files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Monocurl is a scripting language (based on the Manim Python library) and a desktop application. Its primary purpose is to allow science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM) enthusiasts to create slides of programmatic animations as if they were using a video editor.
To create an MCF file, select New Scene from the Home screen in Monocurl. You can then configure each slide in the slideshow via the Editor or import media files.

instructions: You can open MCF files with Monocurl in Windows, macOS, and Linux. To open an MCF file with Monocurl, select File â†’ Import.
You can also open MCF files with a text editor since they store plain text. Some options include Microsoft Notepad (Windows), Apple TextEdit (macOS), or gedit (Linux).
However, opening MCF files with a text editor will not appear the same as Monocurl. Also, if you incorrectly edit the file, you may inadvertently corrupt the slideshow project.
